The 'Palme d'Or' () is the highest prize awarded at the Cannes Film Festival and
is presented to the director of the best feature film of the official competition. http://www.festival-
cannes.com/en/about/palmeHistory.html It was introduced in 1955 by the
organising committee. From 1939 to 1954, the highest prize was the Grand Prix du
Festival International du Film. In 1964 it was replaced once again by
the Grand Prix du Festival before being reintroduced in 1974.
